creditline: Gift of the Print and Drawing Curatorial Council
description: seated woman wearing a pink tank top and black heels, holding on her lap a man wearing an unbuttoned blue shirt, yellow shorts and veil-like element on his head; smaller elderly seated woman at L holds out her hands

provenance: The artist; [Marlborough Graphics, New York]; sold to MIA, 2005.
text: Paula Rego, born in Portugal, has been described as “heiress to Goya’s Iberian darkness.” She is a master of aquatint, exploiting the medium to its most eerie and provocative ends.
title: After Hogarth IV
